history.text: Did you enjoy the movie?
Seemed like a fun little adventure.
Do you normally enjoy animated films, or was this the exception?
No, I usually love animated films, such as what Pixar produces. Did you find the message of this one to be on target?
Did I lose you?

I don't normally watch much animation, as my children are mostly grown now. However I did make an exception for this one, as it seemed quite comical.  The message was a little fuzzy for me! I was quite caught up in the laughter it evoked
. I did get that she had quite a struggle trying to prove herself though. Seemed like she had pretty low self-esteem in the beginning of the film.
I suppose it was the little guy winning in the end.
Makes sense. Did you like the voice acting?
Oh yes! They did an incredible job!
I always love a story where the underdog wins in the end
Would you agree that is was as much about Judy learning a lesson as the other characters?
She was so cunning when she recorded his confession! Nice police work! Though, only in Zootopia would that hold up in a court of law.
Tis true, I noticed that right away. Makes for a fun little twist on the movie.
Yes, it seems they all did learn a bit of a lesson.
Though, maybe a little hard learned.
Pretty cool that Nick stood up for her in this scene.
Seems judy had a hard time forgiving herself and moving on, part of her lesson.
I know, right? It was so heartwarming the way Nick & Judy developed such a close relationship throughout the move.
Kinda makes you evaluate your own relationships & judgments on acquaintances.
Interesting idea to have a leader trying to hide from the public, instead of ensuring he is part of them and working with them.

True. Gets you thinking about government in general & the sorts of things that are kept from the public. All in all, it was quite a good movie, considering all the thought that it brings to an adult. Funny how animated films are so entertaining to children, yet they adult setting there can be equally intrigued but on a completely different level!
*the adult
Yes, and finding a way to make us think, while also entertaining us is, in my opinion a great method.
I agree totally!
My script is gone, yours?
Mine is working still
Huh
Well, I guess we continue on as if nothing is changed.
I really enjoyed the way it laid out Nick as such a bad guy in the beginning.
Yeah, Here I find it cool that despite an effort to turn NIck against Judy, he stays loyal and stickc by her when she is injured
Just when you've made up your mind to dislike him, the plot changes & you start feeling sorry for him.
Haha, I know people like that in real life
Your right on that.

It was nice to identify on so many levels with this film. To actually get myself thinking a lot about my own thoughts toward people & how I have been so quick to judge people without actually stopping to consider that there was purpose behind their behavior.
Same here, and so many layers of insite make a film watchable more than one time.
Oh, so true! I honestly can see myself watching this again in the near future.
And, to be honest, even if my son doesn't want to watch it with me, I might watch it alone! =D
Right on! I could see myself sitting down to watch it by myself.

Did you get access to more than just
  2 scenes?
Yes, I got 3. In this third we see corruption again in the leaders, as the new mayoy also tries to thwart their plans

Since night howlers aren't a specific animal it serves to again challenge the stereotypes that plague the
 subconscious.
I wonder if all the government corruption is any sort of play on the current political environment?
Could, however I feel like it goes beyond current climate. However it is timely for it.
Yes, it definitely is

I assume we met our reply goal? I thought it would've ended itself when the time was up? Are we to finish the conversation ourselves? I am briefly looking over the instructions, but not seeing instructions for ending the chat.
Beyond plain corruption it also brings to light that ulterior motives can be a driving factor behind it.
Yeah, I thought it was supposed to be 12 messages.
DO we just click finish conversation?

I believe it was. We've conversed for longer than the 10 - 15 minute allotted time & responded more than the 12 chat responses. I think we're good! Nice to meet you, enjoyed the chat. I'm going to "FINISH CONVERSATION." Enjoy your day.
We are suposed to get a completion code sometime
Take care

uid1response.feedback: The other user quit getting document prompts. However I did, so carried the conversation from there.

uid2response.feedback:
The chat bubbles were difficult to read, as they split words in the middle & continued them on to the next line.
My movie description disappeared after the 2nd scene was given, so it was difficult to continue on with the conversation. However, my partner gave me a brief description of the 3rd scene & we continued on the conversation.
